title: The Meaning of “When One Door Closes Another Opens”

steps.title: This phrase means that loss or failure can lead to new opportunities.
steps.content: This phrase means that loss or failure can lead to new opportunities. For example, if you lose your job, you’ll have the chance to apply for a different one, and it may even be better than the one you had before. People usually use this phrase to comfort themselves after they experience a setback, or to encourage others when they’re in tough situations. [1] X Research source “I was sad when I didn’t get into my dream college, but maybe another school will be a better fit for me. When one door closes, another one opens.” “I know you’re upset about the break-up, but when one door closes, another opens. I know your perfect match is out there somewhere.”

steps.title: The phrase comes from a quote by Alexander Graham Bell.
steps.content: The phrase comes from a quote by Alexander Graham Bell. Bell (1847-1922) is famous for being the inventor of the telephone. [2] X Research source The full quote reads: “When one door closes another door opens; but we so often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door, that we do not see the ones which open for us.” The longer quote adds another layer of meaning to the phrase. It suggests that, when we’re too focused on the thing we lost (the closed door), we might not notice a new opportunity that comes up. The message seems to be that it’s important to let go and move on after a setback, so that you’re ready when exciting new opportunities come your way.

steps.title: To encourage someone after they experience a loss or failure
steps.content: To encourage someone after they experience a loss or failure If a friend or family member loses their job, goes through a break-up, or experiences some other type of setback, try saying “when one door closes, another one opens” to comfort them and encourage them to keep going. Here are some examples: “I’m so sorry you didn’t get the promotion—you really deserved it. But when one door closes, another opens. This could be the perfect time for you to look around and see what other jobs are out there.” “I'm really sorry about the break-up. You’re such an incredible person, and I know there’s someone out there who’s going to love you for you. When one door closes, another door opens.”

steps.title: To remind yourself that setbacks can lead to new opportunities
steps.content: To remind yourself that setbacks can lead to new opportunities If you experience a disappointing situation, the phrase can be a helpful reminder that it’s not the end of the world, and that new opportunities could be right around the corner. For example: “I’m pretty bummed that I didn’t get that job I applied for, but I know there’s something out there that’s an even better fit for me. When one door closes, another door opens.” “I had my heart set on the lead role in the play, but I actually think the role I got is a more interesting character, and it will give me a chance to show off my acting skills. When one door closes, another opens. ”

steps.title: Focus on the future, and work on letting go of the past.
steps.content: Focus on the future, and work on letting go of the past. If you’re stuck ruminating on the doors that have closed for you, it’s easy to miss new opportunities. However, once you let go of the setbacks and failures of the past, you can direct your energy to the exciting things ahead. And, when you’re facing forward instead of looking back, you’re much more likely to see any doors that might open around you. [3] X Research source Here are some tips: Remind yourself this isn’t the end of the story. This disappointing experience is just one chapter of your life, and it will pass. Try to be patient , and remind yourself that new opportunities will arise eventually. [4] X Research source Practice gratitude for what you do have. Gratitude is a powerful force that can help you let go of your disappointment over the things you’ve lost, which in turn helps you turn your gaze to the future. There are lots of ways to do this, but making a gratitude list or keeping a gratitude journal are good places to start. [5] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source Be kind to yourself. If you’re beating yourself up about your mistakes, you’re still stuck in the past. Instead, try to practice self-compassion and forgive yourself for any missteps. Remind yourself of all your positive qualities. This will help you feel confident and ready to succeed, and when you're in this mindset, you're more likely to recognize open doors and new opportunities as they arise. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Every cloud has a silver lining
steps.content: Every cloud has a silver lining This phrase means that there’s an upside to every disappointing situation. [7] X Research source For example, if you’re going through a tough break-up, the silver lining could be that now you’re free to focus on improving yourself and figuring out what you want in a future partner. Here are a few more examples: “It’s a bummer that I didn’t get the job, but every cloud has a silver lining. They didn’t offer great benefits, and now I have time to look for a different job that does.” “I’m sad that she doesn’t want to be friends anymore, but I’m also a little relieved. We were fighting a lot, so I think this will be better for my mental health. Every cloud has a silver lining.”

steps.title: When life gives you lemons, make lemonade
steps.content: When life gives you lemons, make lemonade People use this phrase to encourage others to stay positive and make the best out of tough situations. It’s basically a synonym for “every cloud has a silver lining.” [8] X Research source “It was disappointing to get rejected from the college I wanted to go to, but it gave me the chance to explore other options, and I found a school with better financial aid. When life gives you lemons, make lemonade!”

steps.title: There are plenty of fish in the sea
steps.content: There are plenty of fish in the sea This phrase has a similar meaning to “when one door closes, another door opens,” but it’s mainly used in a romantic context. People say it to remind others that there are lots of potential matches out there if they’re sad about a break-up. [9] X Research source “I’m so sorry about the break-up, but he didn't appreciate you enough. There are plenty of fish in the sea, and I know you’ll find someone who understands how amazing you are.”
